Set a Schedule

Source: R/schedule.R
set_schedule.Rd

Sets the schedule for a given Variant. Requires a Schedule object (as returned by get_variant_schedule())

set_schedule(.schedule, ...)

set_schedule_minute(
  .schedule,
  n = 30,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_hour(
  .schedule,
  n = 1,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_day(
  .schedule,
  n = 1,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_weekday(
  .schedule,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_week(
  .schedule,
  n = 1,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_dayofweek(
  .schedule,
  days,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_semimonth(
  .schedule,
  first = TRUE,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_dayofmonth(
  .schedule,
  n = 1,
  day = 1,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_dayweekofmonth(
  .schedule,
  n = 1,
  day = 1,
  week = 1,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_year(
  .schedule,
  n = 1,
  start_time = Sys.time(),
  activate = TRUE,
  email = FALSE
)

set_schedule_remove(.schedule)

Arguments

.schedule

A schedule object. As returned by get_variant_schedule()
...

Scheduling parameters
n

The "number of" iterations
start_time

The start time of the schedule
activate

Whether to publish the output of this schedule
email

Whether to send emails on this schedule
days

The days of the week (0-6)
first

logical Whether to execute on the 1st and 15th (TRUE) or 14th and last (FALSE)
day

The day of the week (0-6) or day of the month (0-31)
week

The week of the month (0-5)
schedule

A JSON blob (as a string) describing the schedule. See "More Details"

Value

An updated Schedule object

Details

  • set_schedule() is a raw interface to RStudio Connect's schedule API

  • set_schedule_*() functions provide handy wrappers around set_schedule()

  • set_schedule_remove() removes a schedule / un-schedules a variant

Beware, using set_schedule() currently uses the RStudio Connect schedule API directly, and so can be a little clunky. Using the set_schedule_*() is generally recommended.

See also

Other schedule functions: get_variant_schedule()

Contents
